title: How to Make Crock Pot Swiss Steak

steps.headline: Pat the steak dry.
steps.description: Absorb any moisture with paper towels.

steps.headline: Cut off any excess fat.
steps.description: Use a sharp knife to trim off fat that is on the sides or on the steak itself.

steps.headline: Cut the meat in good chunks, if needed.
steps.description: Assure that the pieces fit your slow cooker. You still want them to be good portioned sizes, not bite sized chunks unless you are preparing beef stew.

text: Preparing the Meat Pat the steak dry. Absorb any moisture with paper towels. Cut off any excess fat. Use a sharp knife to trim off fat that is on the sides or on the steak itself. Cut the meat in good chunks, if needed. Assure that the pieces fit your slow cooker. You still want them to be good portioned sizes, not bite sized chunks unless you are preparing beef stew. Flour your cutting board. Sprinkle a generous amount of flour on the board and coat your meat with it. Season with salt and pepper, for taste. Preheat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the vegetable oil to the skillet. Brown the steaks. Sear them for a few minutes and then repeat on the other side. Drain the oil. Remove the steak from the heat and drain the oil appropriately. Preparing the Slow Cooker Spray the slow cooker beforehand. Using a non-stick spray around the inside of the cooker avoids the food sticking to it and a lot easier to clean. Add the vegetables to the slow cooker. Insert the potatoes, onions, and carrots on the bottom of the cooker. Arrange the swiss steak on top. Garnish it with any other spices you wish to add, such as parsley, garlic powder, etc. Layer the tomatoes and sauce on top.  Cook everything. Allow it to cook for 6 hours on HIGH or 10 hours on LOW. Finished.
